segments.text: Ew, that water spilling out is disgusting; it's everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink's clogged or something, just letting it pour over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the woman's foot in it— gross, she'll track that mess around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those kids are filthy, climbing up to steal cookies like thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's dirty from the floor, and he's all over it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Girl's hand out, probably covered in who knows what.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Puddle's widening, soaking the cabinets; what a nasty sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's polishing that plate while chaos reigns— oblivious and unclean.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden looks clean outside, but this kitchen's a pigsty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cookies in the jar might get crumbs everywhere now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand how sloppy this whole scene is.
segments.speaker: PAR
